q_eg_start.text: (You approach {npc:3575}. He smirks, shuffling cards or coins.)\nWell, well, look who it is. If you're here to play, be my guest. If you're just watching â€“ don't disturb fortune smiling upon the best of us.

options.text: I'm asking about item {item:180}. They say you have it.

q_eg_earrings_mention.text: Ah, {item:180}! (Laughs) Right, I remember that one. Poor {npc:3441}, he was so upset when he lost it. Nice piece, can't deny it. So, did he send you to beg for it back?

options.text: He asked for it back. Perhaps for a reward?
I'm here on my own behalf. Give back {item:180}.

q_eg_refuse_reward.text: A reward? (Snorts) I don't need his pennies. But you know, I could return {item:180}... if you do something for me. A favor for a favor, so to speak.

q_eg_demand_fail.text: Give it back? (Laughs louder) Why should I? I won it fair and square. Get lost before I get angry.

q_eg_give_task.text: There's a bothersome priest, {npc:321}, in the Black Cathedral. He owes me... let's just say, not money. I need an old scroll ({item:268}) that he keeps. Bring it to me, and {item:180} is yours. Just no funny business, try not to kill him, I don't need the extra trouble.

options.text: I'm not getting involved with priests.

q_eg_refuse_task.text: Your choice. Means you won't see the earrings either.
